subject: Real Estate
title: What Owning Property Actually Means
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Owning Property Actually Means.

hook.text: You 'own' your home â€” but try building a third floor without a permit, and the city will stop you.

buildup.text: Property ownership isn't absolute. It's a bundle of rights: to use, lease, sell, and exclude others.

discovery.text: Governments retain the power to tax, regulate, and even take your property through eminent domain.

twist.text: In some legal systems, you can own the building but not the land. China does this for all urban property.

climax.text: Ownership is not one right â€” it's a bundle, and every bundle has strings attached.

punchline.text: You don't own property. You own a set of permissions.

quiz.question: What does the 'bundle of rights' concept describe?
options: The separate rights that make up property ownership
